executionDetails: Researched 5 cross-platform variants for Python script execution. Created comprehensive analysis document with pros/cons for each approach. Recommended Variant 1 (using 'python' instead of 'python3'). Created migration prompt ready for implementation. Files: cross-platform-analysis.md, P01-implementation.md, P01-recommended-prompt.md
Implemented cross-platform migration: updated 5 prompt files replacing python3 with python, added Requirements section to README.md, verified shebang, tested on Linux
Merged rdd.07-update-docs into rdd.08-wrap-up prompt. Reformatted rdd.08 to match rdd.09 style. Deprecated rdd.07. Documentation updates now integrated into wrap-up workflow as S01

Verified that functionality to copy clarity-checklist.md and version-control.md was already removed during bash-to-Python migration. No action needed - Python implementation never had this functionality

Implemented init_rdd_docs() function to automatically initialize .rdd-docs directory with 5 core templates (backlog.md, requirements.md, tech-spec.md, folder-structure.md, data-model.md) when creating new changes. Function handles three scenarios: missing directory, partial templates, and existing templates. Integrated into create_change() workflow. All 4 test scenarios passed successfully.
